title: Profiles In Soil Health: "Enhancing Soil Systems Utilizing Grazing Practices" With Steve Reimer

tasks.task: Discussing the legacy and evolution of a family farm.
subtasks: Mentioning the family's long-standing connection to the farm.
Describing the initial focus on Hereford cattle by the great-grandfather.
Explaining past grazing practices with larger pastures.
Highlighting the shift towards smaller, trap-style grazing areas.
Detailing the seasonal adjustment of grazing based on grass availability.
Discussing the role of weather in agricultural planning.
Addressing the integration of cereal grain byproducts into grazing systems.
Describing the use of cover crops and corn residue for cow grazing.
Emphasizing the benefits of enhancing the farm system with microbial activity.
Mentioning the goals of environmental resilience and soil quality.
Discussing the farm's profitability through diverse agricultural practices.
